vfLBcIThC_01-l_Wpd5Dvw.text: this might be my favorite sushi place in Singapore!  how can you beat getting some spicy tuna roll and some AMAZING steak with garlic chips on the side cooked perfectly in front of you.  the sushi selection is not extensive but have most of the normal stuff you would expect.  the teppan grill masters have great personality and interact with all of the people sitting around the tablethey have a nice drink selection and the pricing is reasonable for singapore.  reservations are highly recommended since it is not a huge space.

photos.caption: Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Dinner at the teppenyaki table  (but you don't have to sit here)

ppVvpTD0io9XoKFmTQ0Tqw.text: Popular Japanese place with branches at Chjimes and CBD. Overall, the food is standard good. Basically hits expectation for a semi-upscale Japanese place. Best feature is the variety for lunch sets. There are sushi, sashimi, tempura, beef sets, etc. which are served in a bento box with appetizers, desserts and drinks.Would recommend for a business lunch given its convenient location and consistently good food overall. But don't expect anything particularly good or memorableNeed to make reservations.

h2UtpmfNgyIskS5zqiRcIQ.text: Looking around the place, you can tell that this is definitely a teppanyaki restaurant. There are many tables surrounding a flat hot grill. Being there by myself on my business trip I decided to go for the sushi bar. My rating is based on the sushi bar experience, but also must try the teppanyaki.Ordered the Omakase for a single person. It ended up being a small variety of sashimi pieces. When I get Omakase I expect a collection of artfully crafted pieces of sashimi with thoughtful and original flavoring and sauces. Disappointed to say the least. So in my book, this was just a simple plate of Sashimi. 40 SGD for a small variety of sashimi is extremely expensive compared to what I see in the San Francisco/San Jose area. Since the variety was so small, also ordered the spicy tuna maki and a Maguro and Shake Salmon sushi. Incredibly the spicy tuna was 12 SGD and the single pieces of Maguro and Shake were 4 SGD each. Wow, I'm definitely not used to these prices. I wonder if most of Singapore is like this. The Sashimi order was just ok, the fish did taste pretty fresh as expected being on an island. The spicy tuna was very disappointing. It had a small piece of maguro with some spice to it and a small piece of tempura of some sort. Disappointed in this place for sure. Would give it 2 stars except I probably should have gotten the Teppanyaki. The sushi is definitely not what you come here for.

photos.caption: Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Spicy tuna, maguro, shake
Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Omakase for 1 person. I would call it a small Sashimi rather than Omakase.

meFJuaPglPryhxVabJQtrg.text: This was an excelllent dining experience.We decided to meet at Chijmes and then select a place to eat.  I had been told Japanese Dining Sun was very good.  However, when we checked, they said it would be at least an hour before we could be seated.Earlier, we had noticed Tatsu and that it was not very busy.  We circled back and were quickly seated at their dining bar.The ambiance is sparse but stylish.  The service is impeccable with definite touches o Japanese conservatism.Very soon, we were enjoying a very nice sake and placing our order.The food arrived in a steady stream.First up, was the sushi plate and the fried fish.My friend does not eat raw fish.   So, I tackled most of the nigiri and she went to work on the rolls.  It was all delicious.  The fish was very fresh and of the highest quality.  The flavors were so delicate.  The vinegar rice was also well prepared.tinyurl.com/8obdqmtAlong with the sushi, they brought the fried fish dish.  This was the least impressive part of the meal.  There wasn't anything particulary wrong with it.  The dish simply did not stand out.tinyurl.com/d9fkpyzThe next dish to arrive was the clams in broth.  This was a very light dish with very subtle flavors.  My friend was in heaven.tinyurl.com/8na8qfbAlso, at this time, they brought out the baked clam dish.  In comparison to the mild clams in broth, this was very rich with cheese and strong savoury flavors.tinyurl.com/932msx5The last dish was the pork belly.  Along with the sushi, for me, this was the highlight of the meal.tinyurl.com/8vssstdI am not sure why this restaurant isn't always packed.  It is a wonderful culinary delight.  The ambiance, food, and service provide a seamless enjoybale experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Fried Fish - Tatsu Sushi - Chjimes - Singapore
Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Clams in broth - Tatsu Sushi - Chjimes - Singapore
Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Baked Clams - Tatsu Sushi - Chjimes - Singapore

BsPTGXCz2Rh5YzLd-A14Yw.text: With the help of my trusty Yelp application my boyfriend and I found this place our first night in Singapore. Located in Chijmes it was easy to find and NO ONE was eating there. Lucky for us because it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. The entire restaurants attention was on us. Chef Kenny was our main sushi chef and he was on point! We never even ordered off the menu. He asked us what we didn't like- (which was only salmon for me- dirty dirty salmon) and then proceeded to feed us course after course of delicious, beautifully prepared food. The madai sashimi was on of my favs. We also had huge pacific gulf oysters. They served us a steamed fish with root veggies in a great sauce. There was also baked razor clams with a cheesy creamy topping baked to a crisp. Soooo good. The white tuna was marinated in usukuchi and served sushi style with a bit of grated lemon peel. It was my favorite of everything we ate. We finished with black sesame ice cream. Service was impeccable and I loved every moment of the meal. I would come back here in a heartbeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Pacific oyster
Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Sashimi platter
Photo of Tatsu Sushi - Singapore, Singapore. Marinated white tuna sushi with lemon zest

7yKKPw_X4g6a-mbT5rf9UQ.text: Its flavor is a bit too heavy, but the staff are really friendly and have given many good recommendations.

UvMHs7AKpTWUEKW8R5i3SA.text: Surprised that nobody put a review yet.This is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in entire Singapore.  Have been there several times and it's often visited by Japanese people, which should say something about authenticity and quality.  One of few places that has chazuke on their menu.  Sushi is orgasmic (yes, I am using that word) and rest of their food on the menu is amazing.  It's little pricey and they don't have lots of seating area but definitely worth trying.  I highly recommend it.

KvrbxivInG-IlfYYGfUjag.text: I had the special bento which had tempura, sushi, and sashimi. Overall everything was good. The fish was fresh and the tempura was crispy and light. It was odd that they included a raw shrimp though with the sashimi, which I had never seen before. It was a lot of food and a good deal. The rectangular flavored cold egg with black writing stamped on top was surprisingly tasty. The service was great also.

Nenkyt0USm6T-ZroT4UaKQ.text: Solid Japanese food.  Chijmes is incredibly touristy.  If you can get passed that,  this is a good joint.  Pricy though.
